data.title: The full list of South Australians on the 2024 Australia Day Honours list
data.meta_description: The Honours and Awards system gives the nation a chance to celebrate and acknowledge those who work tirelessly to improve local communities and to make Australia a better place.
data.text:
Share

Tweet

Share

Share

Email

The 2024 Australia Day Honours list recognises and celebrates 1,042 Australians, including awards in the Order of Australia (General and Military Divisions), meritorious awards and recognition for distinguished and conspicuous service.

The Australian Honours and Awards system recognises the outstanding service and contributions of Australians.

Recipients come from right across the country and from all walks of life. While some are well-known, the majority are unsung heroes.

While typically they haven’t sought thanks or recognition, they deserve both. The Honours and Awards system gives the nation a chance to celebrate and acknowledge those who work tirelessly to improve local communities and to make Australia a better place.

Here’s a run down on which South Australians made the list.

Order of Australia – General Division

Appointed as an Officer of the Order of Australia (AO)

Mr Bruce James CARTER

College Park SA 5069

For distinguished service to business, to charitable organisations, and to the community.

Professor Sarah Anne ROBERTSON

Dulwich SA 5065

For distinguished service to medical research, particularly reproductive biology and immunology, and to professional societies.

Appointed as a Member of the Order of Australia (AM)

Associate Professor Barbara BAIRD

SA

For significant service to community health through prochoice advocacy, and to tertiary education.

Mr John Russell BAKER ESM

Fitzroy SA 5082

For significant service to surf lifesaving, to veterans, and to the community.

Emeritus Professor Leigh Alexander BURGOYNE

Mitcham SA 5062

For significant service to science, particularly through the development of DNA technologies.

Ms Brigid Anne COOMBE

SA

For significant service to community health, particularly through advocacy to improve abortion care access.

Ms Heather Ann CROALL

SA

For significant service to the performing arts, as an administrator, advocate and film maker.

Ms Carmen Anne GARCIA

Mylor SA 5153

For significant service to the multicultural community through diversity and inclusion advocacy and progams.

Mr Ashleigh Quentin GORE

Hahndorf SA 5245

For significant service to the community through a range of roles.

Ms Sharon Anne HANLON

SA

For significant service to the community through a range of organisations and leadership roles.

Mr Robert Ashley HOFF

Myrtlebank SA 5064

For significant service to primary education, and to professional associations.

Mr John IRVING

Gilberton SA 5081

For significant service to the arts, and to business.

Ms Kate Jill LLEWELLYN

Hove SA 5048

For significant service to literature as an author and poet.

Mr Richard John PERSSE

SA

For significant service to public administration, and to the community of South Australia.

Mr Raymond John SPENCER

Leawood Gardens SA 5150

For significant service to business, and to the community through a range of organisations.

Awarded the Medal of the Order of Australia (OAM)

Mr George Albert ADLER

Yankalilla SA 5203

For service to the community through a range of organisations.

Mr George BELPERIO

Adelaide SA 5000

For service to the Italian community of South Australia.

Mr Arch BOONEN

SA

For service to the community through a range of roles.

Mrs Carlsa Joyce CARTER

Bridgewater SA 5155

For service to conservation and the environment.

Mr John Clifford CHAPMAN

Aldgate SA 5154

For service to public administration in South Australia.

Mr Peter George CHRISTOPHER

Athelstone SA 5076

For service to community history.

Mr Cyril David COCKSHELL

Gawler East SA 5118

For service to the community through a range of organisations, and to geophysics.

Mr Jeffrey DRY

Payneham South SA 5070

For service to community sport, and to the church.

Dr Barry ELSEY

Fitzroy SA 5082

For service to tertiary education.

Dr Margaret Anne FOLKARD

Kilburn SA 5084

For service to gnomonics, and to the community.

Reverend Patrick Joseph GILLESPIE

Pasadena SA 5042

For service to youth through school-based sport

programs.

Mr Robert Hugh GRANT

Cheltenham SA 5014

For service to local government, and to the community

Mr Michael John HOLLAND

Coonalpyn SA 5265

For service to the community through emergency response organisations.

Ms Julie Katherine LOW

Port Lincoln SA 5606

For service to the community of the Lower Eyre Peninsula.

Mr William Maxwell LYLE

Magill SA 5072

For service to the creative arts as a sculptor

Mr David Burnett MCNEIL

Unley Park SA 5061

For service to business, and to professional associations.

Mr Nicola MINICOZZI

SA

For service to the Italian community of South Australia.

The late Mr Paul Simon MURRAY

Happy Valley SA 5159

For service to gymnastics as an administrator and coach.

Mr Raymond James NORTON

Klemzig SA 5087

For service to the community of Adelaide

Mr Noel Donald O’BRIEN

Tusmore SA 5065

For service to the community through a range of roles.

Mr Francis Joseph O’NEILL

Unley SA 5061

For service to the community through a range of organisations.

The Reverend Barbara Ann PAULL-HUNT

North Brighton SA 5048

For service to the Anglican Church of Australia.

Mr Stuart PAXTON

Riverton SA 5412

For service to the community through a range of roles.

Ms Diané RANCK

Seacliff SA 5049

For service to the community through a range of organisations.

Mr Craig Ernest SCOTT

West Beach SA 5024

For service to the community through a range of organisations.

Dr David Arley SQUIRRELL

Mrs Yvonne Jean TYLER

Mr Willem VAN KEULEN

All Australians given Honours in 2024

The General Division of the Order of Australia

The 739 recipients of awards (all recipients name and citation) in the General Division of the Order of Australia include:

4 appointments as Companions of the Order

38 appointments as Officers of the Order

194 appointments as Members of the Order

503 people were awarded the Medal of the Order of Australia

Meritorious awards

The 224 recipients of Meritorious awards include recipients of the Public Service Medal, the Australian Police Medal, the Australian Fire Service Medal, the Ambulance Service Medal, the Emergency Services Medal, the Australian Corrections Medal, and the Australian Intelligence Medal.

all recipients (name and citation)

additional information about recipients

Military Awards

There were 20 recipients of awards in the Military Division of the Order of Australia (1 AO, 9 AM, 10 OAM) and 59 Distinguished and Conspicuous awards.

all recipients (name and citation)

additional information about recipients

COVID-19 Honour Roll

The 2024 Australia Day Honours List includes 49 Australians recognised for their contribution in support of Australia’s response to the COVID-19 pandemic. COVID-19 Honour Roll
